data.title: Development build and WindowsUniversal project version issues
data.body:
Creating an issue here and will be submitting a pull request against it shortly as the WindowsUniversal project template isn't quite right.

The problem is that it currently uses 10.0.10240.0 as the version number. This is fine if you have the old SDK installed but the current SDK is 10.0.10586.0. Without the old version installed you cannot create a new Windows 10 project. The dependency versioning is complicated and probably the cause of some issues people are having so here's what I'm seeing:

The 3.4 build uses an old TargetPlatformVersion in the .csproj template as well it's missing the project.json file (the zip file it installs is also named WindowUAP.zip and should be WindowsUniversal.zip)

The 3.5 build uses the 10240 TargetPlatformVersion and has the extra files with the correctly named zip file.

If you go to the SDK archive page and download the RTM version (https://dev.windows.com/en-us/downloads/sdk-archive) it will install version 10.0.10240 of the SDK which works with the 3.5 build (the version displayed on the screen says 10.0.26624 whcih installs to the 10.0.10240.0 folder which works with the 3.5 build). Confused?

You have to download the current SDK (https://dev.windows.com/en-us/downloads/windows-10-sdk) to get version 10586 so I'm going to submit a pull request that sets the minimum version to 10240 and the target version to 10586. This works for people that have the old SDK installed and the new one.

data.title: Monogame using.net4.5 is incompatible with visual studio 2010 express
data.body: After running "Protobuild", the "TargetFrameworkVersion" property in the generated .csproj files reference "V4.5" which appears incompatible with visual studio 2010 express. On my branch, I changed them to "V4.0" on the ".Windows" projects and the solution now appears workable in visual studio 2010 express. I suspect referencing "V4.5" in the windows versions of the .csproj files was unintentional.

data.title: MonoGame WindowsUAP install doesn't match source
data.body:
I think I've confirmed this on a clean machine now, the WindowsUAP.zip file that contains the universal files doesn't match what's in the repo. This is from the official 3.4 build available from the download page.

I checked a new copy of the WindowsUAP.zip file in \Documents\Visual Studio 2015\Templates\ProjectTemplates\Visual C#\MonoGame and found two problems:
1. The .csproj file template uses the wrong TargetPlatformVersion and TargetPlatformMinVersion values. They're 10.0.10069.0 for both values and should be at least 10.0.10240.0 but if you're using the latest SDK then the TargetPlatformMinVersion should be 10.0.10240.0 and TargetPlatformVersion should be 10.0.10586.0. This is correct in the github source but the 3.4 zip file contains an old version.
2. The project.json file is missing in the zip file. This will fail the build if you get past the version check by manually editing the .csproj file and reloading. The .json file is in the github folder.

I think it's just a distribution/packaging error somewhere as the code in the repo is correct.

data.title: Version number on MonoGame installer ?
data.body:
Hi,

all MonoGame installers share the same name, MonoGameSetup.exe . I don't know if this is this way on purpose, or just very difficult to get/maintain, but It would be great if the installer (at least for development builds) would include some kind of version in its name.

data.body: Converted source code to Window 10 UAP.  Removed XNA content projects and implemented MonoGame content pipeline tool.

data.title: Fix for OpenTK Viewport initialization
data.body:
Fixes #4354

> I've noticed a discrepancy between Windows and DesktopGL platforms regarding GraphicsDevice.Viewport initialization.
> 
> On Windows, the GraphicsDevice.Viewport is initialized by GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges(), but on DesktopGL, GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges() doesn't initialize it.
> It seems to be only initialized upon Game.Initialize() (base class).

@cra0zy Would mind reviewing it?

data.title: [MGCB] Clean target handles output path that differs from source path
data.body:
Previously, cleaning of content was presupposing that the output content resided in the same location as the source file, which is not always the case.

As an aside, I also needed to update to the latest Dependencies in order to compile the MGCB on the Mac.

Previous pull request: #4268

@tomspilman:

> We should also test XNA to see what it does when you try to set a singular value on a array type. Does it allow it? If so do we observe the same behavior.

I tested a sample XNA project for this, and it does not allow it. ("Specified cast is not valid.")

data.title: MonoGame Pipeline on windows 10 missing library
data.body:
I have latest MonoGame from source and also the latest Windows 10 (will all updates installed), I am getting this exception when I try to build FBX model:

C:/Users/admin/Desktop/programy/devkniha/zvb23/zvb2/Rabaty/RabatyContent/zvb2/sklepeni/sklepeni_chodba005p_Low.fbx: error: Importer 'FbxImporter' had unexpected failure!
Assimp.AssimpException: Error loading unmanaged library from path: Assimp64.dll, see inner exception for details.
Uvedeně modul nebyl nalezen. (Vějimka na z kladŘ hodnoty HRESULT: 0x8007007E) ---> System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Uvedeně modul nebyl nalezen. (Vějimka na z kladŘ hodnoty HRESULT: 0x8007007E)
   --- Konec trasov nˇ z sobnˇku pro vnitýnˇ vějimku ---
   v Assimp.Unmanaged.AssimpLibraryWindowsImplementation.NativeLoadLibrary(String path)
   v Assimp.Unmanaged.AssimpLibraryImplementation.LoadAssimpLibrary(String path)
   v Assimp.Unmanaged.AssimpLibrary.LoadLibrary()
   v Assimp.Unmanaged.AssimpLibrary.LoadIfNotLoaded()
   v Assimp.Unmanaged.AssimpLibrary.CreatePropertyStore()
   v Assimp.AssimpContext.CreateConfigs()
   v Assimp.AssimpContext.ImportFile(String file, PostProcessSteps postProcessFlags)
   v Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.OpenAssetImporter.Import(String filename, ContentImporterContext context) v c:\Users\admin\Desktop\programy\devkniha\zvb23\Libs\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline\OpenAssetImporter.cs:ý dek 220
   v Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.FbxImporter.Import(String filename, ContentImporterContext context) v c:\Users\admin\Desktop\programy\devkniha\zvb23\Libs\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline\FbxImporter.cs:ý dek 22
   v Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentImporter`1.Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentImporter.Import(String filename, ContentImporterContext context) v c:\Users\admin\Desktop\programy\devkniha\zvb23\Libs\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline\ContentImporter.cs:ý dek 45
   v MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.ProcessContent(PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent) v c:\Users\admin\Desktop\programy\devkniha\zvb23\Libs\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline\Builder\PipelineManager.cs:ý dek 577

data.title: Fix for OS X OpenAL implementation when accessing a disposed source
data.body:
It looks like OS X OpenAL implementation handles `AL.GetSourceState` differently. It raises an error flag if `alSourceId` is disposed, while on other systems it returns `ALSourceState.Stopped` with no error. Hence, calling `OggStream.Stop()` should be prevented if the stream has already been disposed, otherwise it just crash on OS X.

Fixes #4346 

More details in the issue report.

@cra0zy Mind reviewing this one?

data.title: Updated Dependencies
data.body: https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame.Dependencies/pull/66

data.title: Fix for small size spritefonts
data.body:
Fixes issue #4305.
Changes:
Convert ImportGlyph method from static method to instance method.
Added method ExpandByte, to convert each bit in a byte to a byte.
Added processing code inside ImportGlyph to handle the case where
glyphs' bitmaps have only 1 bit per pixel

That ExpandByte method is inside SharpfontImporter just to keep it together with the rest of the changes. My opinion is to move it to MathHelper as an extension method, but i'm open to suggestions.

data.title: [Linux Installer] Automatically override the old addin
Figure out what to do about Xamarin.Mac on the build server
data.body:
Just creating an issue here based on discussion with @tomspilman in #4343.  Basically there was an issue where someone changed something and it broke the Xamarin.Mac implementation but not the MonoMac implementation.  Right now, the MonoGame build server doesn't have the latest version of Xamarin Mac installed.

I think the path forward looks something like this:
- Get an open source license of Xamarin Mac installed on the MonoGame build server
- Add some command line flag like `--force-mac-api-version MonoMac` to Protobuild
- Add build targets to test it
- Only ship one of these implementations in NuGet etc, because the whole API-breaking by Xamarin is a silly mess and we'll end up with 3 NuGet packages for different Mac APIs otherwise

data.title: Reduced garbage generation in SpriteBatcher
data.body:
I was doing some profiling of my game, and came across this:

![before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5249498/11946231/7ba8c8ae-a893-11e5-93a2-06ebd9e1a0c9.png)

What was happening was that the vertex array was only growing to exactly match the number of items in a batch, rather than growing by a percentage like the sprite batch array is. This could put a lot of load on the GC if the number of sprites being drawn was increasing over time (which was happening in my game) as the vertex array would continually be getting resized.

To resolve this, I changed the vertex array to grow in line with the sprite batch array instead. After profiling again, it now looks like this:

![after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5249498/11946313/29ff48ba-a894-11e5-883a-9709ea1f6546.png)

data.title: Windows DX: Return correct location for Game.Window.ClientBounds
data.body: This fixes the bug described in issue #4344 for the Windows DirectX build.

data.title: Game.Window.ClientBounds returns incorrect location
data.body:
When using XNA, `Game.Window.ClientBounds` returns the desktop location of the upper-left corner of the client area (i.e. the internal area of a window which doesn't include window borders, title bar, etc).

But in the Windows and WindowsGL builds, MonoGame is currently always returning (0, 0). There are likely more builds also affected (very likely Linux, maybe others).

I have a fix for the Windows (DirectX) build and I will submit a PR for this shortly.

However, I am not sure of the fix for WindowsGL / DesktopGL builds. I took a quick look into it, but could not see how to obtain the same position via the OpenTK INativeWindow interface. It only seems to give the desktop location of the entire window (including borders, etc). I could not find a way getting the desktop location of the internal client area.

data.title: Add PlatformGetMaxNumberOfGamePads method to Xamarin.Mac
data.body:
Looks like someone changed the implementation of GamePads but didn't update the Xamarin.Mac implementation (or it was just because of the timing in merging the Xamarin.Mac changes in).

This updated the Xamarin.Mac input implementation to have the right methods on it.

data.title: Allow ContentImporters to accept streams in addition to filenames
Updated Protobuild
data.body:
This fixes the Linux Pipeline Tool problem @hach-que caused with #4282

Long story short, she did not merge changes of #4243 done to xslt so LocalCopy was setting to true, and because libraries were being copied, Pipeline Tool would use local dlls instead of system ones(and this causes a crash because no config files are copied and tool tries to load Window dlls).

data.title: Concensus? Should we drop the WindowsPhone8 project?
data.body:
Supporting the old WindowsPhone8 project is such a pain with it's reliance on the old XNA libraries (as I'm reminded yet again when doing a global update)

As MS don't readily support the building of these now in favour of 8.1 projects only or Win 10, should we drop this platform for the next release?

I think the same has also been said about dropping Win8 in favour of updating that platform to Win8.1 (since we are forced to re-target on new projects now)
